item.title: Hacker sneaks infostealer malware into early access Steam game
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A threat actor called EncryptHub has compromised a game on Steam to distribute info-stealing malware to unsuspecting users downloading the title. [...]

item.title: Mitel warns of critical MiVoice MX-ONE authentication bypass flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Mitel Networks has released security updates to patch a critical-severity authentication bypass vulnerability impacting its MiVoice MX-ONE enterprise communications platform. [...]

item.title: Hackers breach Toptal GitHub account, publish malicious npm packages
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers compromised Toptal's GitHub organization account and used their access to publish ten malicious packages on the Node Package Manager (NPM) index. [...]

item.title: SonicWall urges admins to patch critical RCE flaw in SMA 100 devices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: SonicWall urges customers to patch SMA 100 series appliances against a critical authenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability that can let attackers gain remote code execution. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: SharePoint flaws exploited in Warlock ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A China-based hacking group is deploying Warlock ransomware on Microsoft SharePoint servers vulnerable to widespread attacks targeting the recently patched ToolShell zero-day exploit chain. [...]

item.title: Brave blocks Windows Recall from screenshotting your browsing activity
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Brave Software says its privacy-focused browser will block Microsoft's Windows Recall from capturing screenshots of Brave windows by default to protect users' privacy. [...]

item.title: Proton launches privacy-respecting encrypted AI assistant Lumo
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Proton has launched a new tool called Lumo, offering a privacy-first AI assistant that does not log user conversations and doesn't use their prompts for training. [...]

item.title: Hackers fooled Cognizant help desk, says Clorox in $380M cyberattack lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Clorox is suing IT giant Cognizant for gross negligence, alleging it enabled a massive August 2023 cyberattack by resetting an employee's password for a hacker without first verifying their identity. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT is rolling out 'personality' toggles to become your assistant
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is rolling out a new "personality" feature on the ChatGPT web app. This allows you to choose between multiple personalities, such as "Robot." [...]

item.title: NPM package ‘is’ with 2.8M weekly downloads infected devs with malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The popular NPM package 'is' has been compromised in a supply chain attack that injected backdoor malware, giving attackers full access to compromised devices. [...]

item.title: US nuclear weapons agency hacked in Microsoft SharePoint attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Unknown threat actors have breached the National Nuclear Security Administration's network in attacks exploiting a recently patched Microsoft SharePoint zero-day vulnerability chain. [...]

item.title: OpenAI confirms ChatGPT's new study feature, helps with exams
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is testing a new 'Study together' feature, and today, a new announcement within the ChatGPT web app confirms it. [...]

item.title: How to harden your Active Directory against Kerberoasting
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Specops Software
item.description: Kerberoasting gives attackers offline paths to crack service account password, without triggering alerts. Learn from Specops Software how to protect your Active Directory with stronger SPN password policies and reduced attack surfaces. [...]
